boardgame.name: Greatest Thief
boardgame.description:
You have a priceless artifact that you “acquired” early in your career. The artifact is part of a set, and until recently you had no information regarding the location of the other piece. One of your contacts has just informed you that the other piece is in the hands of a rival “alleged” thief in the area. Your contact also told you this other thief is going to attempt to complete his own set by acquiring your artifact.

In order to win, you must steal your opponent's artifact and make sure they cannot steal it back. You will be able to purchase and install security systems to safeguard your own artifact. You will train up your skills at bypassing the different types of security systems. To fund your endeavors, you will take on smaller heists.

The most unique aspect of the game is that you may only take your turn while your opponent is not around. This means a single game can take days or even weeks to finish, but each turn only takes a few minutes. The game can be stored in the box between turns.

Dice rolling is the primary mechanic for bypassing security systems and accomplishing heists. Each security system has a minimum roll to bypass, and you will roll two dice (D6). Training and some cards you can get during heists can increase your roll.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Psychedelic Owl
boardgame.description: Hunt for prey, catch a rabbit, find a mate, annihilate your ego, and go to sleep in a barn.

boardgame.name: Re;Act - Anime Dueling Card Game
boardgame.description:
Re;Act is a 1 vs 1 grid based dueling game about different artists with super powers based on their medium.

Games are fast paced and immersive thanks to the gorgeous art by WickedAlucard, a cast of highly asymmetric player characters, and an exciting chaining system of reactive card effects.

The characters include a brazen calligrapher whose sword scabbard is giant ink brush, a mysterious dancer whose moves flow like water and summon giant colorful beta fish, and a young sculptor whose creatures come to life to swarm his enemies.

Pick from a cast of TEN unique fighters and enter a grid based map to face off against your opponent to decide whose medium is the superior art form.

Each character comes with a unique pre-built deck of cards, all of which are either "Intents", which start off a chain, or "Reacts", which can be played in response to any intent or react. This react chain is resolved first in last out, and is at the heart of the gameplay.

As you work to damage your opponent or control the board with your character and summons, you'll also be competing to finish your masterpiece before your opponent, a gorgeous 3 card spread of your character's greatest skill. Doing so will grant you powers of your art form's truest expressions, and will be key to victory.

boardgame.name: Conqueror: Duels
boardgame.description:
Conqueror: Duels is a FREE 2 player expansion of Conqueror: Final Conquest. The game is set in the ancient world and pits the Roman Republic against its eternal nemesis - the Carthagian Empire. Relive the epic rivalry between both these great nations. Will Rome conquer Carthage once more? Or will you re-write history?

The game also includes 5 scenarios that allow players to re-enact some of the greatest campaigns of the ancient world including Alexander the Great's conquests, the Gallic Wars, and more.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Kabula
boardgame.description:
In a fantasy Island, a magic tree, the Kabula, is held in a Sanctuary to ensure immortality to all inhabitants. The balance is broken when six deranged characters from Earth find themselves transported to this Island. Their surreal adventures include humorous encounters and heavy satire on several topics.

Kabula is a competitive board game for 2-6 players set in a uniquely twisted fantasy world. It blends a sandbox RPG experience with skirmish elements and a combat system comparable to that of a dungeon crawler. Heroes will develop to one of three possible personalities as they fight and tame monsters, explore dungeons and encounter peculiar quests. Eventually, they clash with each other in pursuit of the Kabula, the tree which holds the fate of the Universe.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Dark Sun Grimoire
El Grimorio del Sol Negro
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Finally, after months of tracking down an evil sorcerer, the PC's manage to find his lair and prepare to face the horrors that surely lay waiting for them within the sanctuary of the sun.

This is a 5e friendly one page adventure that can be easily adapted as a system-agnostic supplement for any other game system.


Al fin, después de meses de sguir la pista de un malvado hechicero, los personajes logran dar con su paradero y se preparan para enfrentar los horrores que seguramente le esperan dentro del santuario del sol.

Esta es una aventura de una sola página amigable con 5e que puede ser fácilmente adaptada cómo un suplemento agnóstico para cualquier otro sistema de juego.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: El Grimorio del Sol Negro PDF

boardgame.name: The Onasti Realm: Book of Lore
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Onasti Realm - Book of Lore Adventure Supplement for the Realm of Onasti This retro style publication provides the new Dungeon Master all the details required for a fun role playing experience.

Learn the secrets of the Black Dragon Clan, discover the Southern Thieves Guild deepest secrets and learn more about the Onasti Realm history and culture. This supplement is the reference book you have been looking for to unlock the history, people and places that make up the incredible Realm of Onasti.

boardgame.name: Mangrels ATE My Servants!!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Introduce Dungeon Crawl Classics characters to the cosmos with this incredible funnel! Hired to infiltrate the factory of industrialist Seraphina von Elrich, the party will come into contact with A BRAIN-ROTTING PLANT FROM BEYOND THE STARS, MAN-EATING MANGRELS, and ALL MANNERS OF VILE ANDROID in this science fiction adventure.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Worlds of Pulp: Wild West Horse Opera Role Playing Game
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pinned down behind the rocks, as a near endless barrage of rifle rounds explode off the crumbling stone; the trail tested hero looked back at the sorrel stallion and the rifle still sheathed in the saddle scabbard. The reports of the weapons sang in the canyon, as the relentless salvo continued. But perhaps, the hero thought, there might still be a way out of this.

As the GM you craft and control the story and its myriad of characters and villains.

As a player, you become the hero of the story, developing an original character from the well-known western archetypes inside. Play in any western setting, it can be horror, pulp, or science fiction.

The power to choose is yours!

Ride, Boldly Ride!
• Simple, fun, and fast 2d6 mechanic
• Rules designed to enhance Role-Playing aspects of game
• S.L.I.C. NPC rules allows GMs to create NPCs with one number, as an alternative to fully fleshed out NPC. This enhances game speed.

• Fully detailed towns of Slow Funeral Ridge, and Gunshot, with maps
• Over 30 Archetypes and 80 Abilities to bring your character to life
• 128 Story hooks to keep games fresh and new
• Random event generators for town and mountain/canyon encounters
• Guidelines for creating original, fast, simple towns.
• Simple encounter definitions allowing you the freedom to tell complicated stories without being encumbered by excessive math.
• Rules for Western Horror, Saddles of Samhain
• Guidlines for Western Pulp and Science Fiction.

boardgame.name: A Quantum Leap
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Potential is everywhere. You can’t really see it, but you can feel it. And all you really need to do is reach out, grab that potential in your hand, and bend it to your will. Nothing goes wrong if you just use your potential. I know it sounds easy. I can’t really tell you how to do it. But when you do, you’ll just know.”
— Janeka Spencer,
Neptune Foundation first responder

This jumpstart has everything you need to start playing an adventure in Trinity Continuum, including:

All the rules you need from Trinity Continuum
A full adventure, “A Quantum Leap,” ready to run
Five ready-made characters for players to pick up and play

boardgame.name: Brides of the Black Earth
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for 3rd Level Characters set in the Shadows over Vathak 5e campaign setting using the world's most popular role-playing game rules!

The bride-to-be has vanished just as the wedding that would unite two warring baronies in Gregoria! You must find the bride-to-be and puzzle out the mystery that threatens not only the nuptials, but the very peace of Gregoria!

boardgame.name: Children of the Scale: The Pariah Ss'ressen Sourcebook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

One of the two ss’ressen egg clutches that escaped the iron grip of the Ssethregoran Empire, the Black Talons found a safe haven in the human lands of Milandir. Even after two centuries of working side-by-side with the Milandisians, their ways are still a mystery to their human allies. Now, those secrets are laid bare as the Black Talon Egg Clutch and their offshoots’ history and culture are revealed.

Delve into this unique and popular player character race as the Ashen Hide, Black Talon, and the Ghost Scale ss’ressen are fully explored.

Within these pages you will find:

The history of the Ashen Hide, Black Talon, and Ghost Scale ss’ressen.
The ss’ressen’s culture, from their caste system to their religious tenets and beliefs.
New Class Archetypes for the Fighter, Holy Champion, Ranger, and Shaman.
New Backgrounds
A new Combat School – Tooth and Claw
New Feats
New Armor and Weapons
New Spells and Magic Items
A dozen Monster entries
Explore Lanpeltis, the City of the Fiery Wyrm


Note: The material contained herein can also be found in the Codex Geographica, vol. II – The Ssethregoran Empire.
boardgame.rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires

boardgame.name: Doomlings
boardgame.description:
Somewhere on a doomed and distant planet, life has emerged, competing for supremacy until the world’s inevitable destruction. The object of the game is to score the most points by the time the world ends. Score points by playing Traits for your Doomlings’ species, making them more adaptable, resilient, and mischievous. As your Doomlings assert their dominance, Catastrophes will befall the planet, causing setbacks for each competing species. When the third Catastrophe inevitably strikes, the world ends, and the Doomlings with the strongest set of traits gets to look the Apocalypse in the eye and declare…“I scored the most points!”

Throughout the game, players draw Trait cards from a community pile, and then play them for points. Traits can also have special abilities and bonuses, allowing players to build a wide range of winning combinations. The game is played in rounds, using Age cards, which have different rules that players must follow. But be warned, hidden in the Ages are Catastrophes: special rounds with adverse effects that force players to adapt their strategy.

Doomlings adds a fun twist to hand management, by introducing the “Gene Pool” mechanic. Your Gene Pool is your hand size: it is unique to you, and it can increase or decrease through special Traits, or even Catastrophes. Doomlings includes 6 colorful Gene Pool counter cards, elegantly tracking how many cards you should hold at the end of your turn. There are opportunities to increase your Gene Pool (hand size), which can give your species a leg up by providing a larger pool of Traits to select from each turn.

A lightweight card game for 2-6 players, Doomlings can be played casually amongst friends, or competitively by the gaming enthusiast family. Because there are no duplicate cards, and Age cards are chosen randomly, no two games are ever the same. While the game itself can be learned in 5 minutes or less, don’t be fooled: with 100+ unique Traits—in Red, Blue, Green, Purple and Colorless—and rare, powerful Dominant Traits, there are countless combinations of play to be discovered.

A typical game takes between 20-45 minutes, depending on the number of players and sequence of events. Advanced-play expansion packs are also available, including a Hidden Objective expansion for a fun twist to the game. Doomlings requires no dice or additional pieces, just a jolly embrace of the inevitable end of the world!

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Cardboard Time Episode 11: Spicy, Res Arcana, Interview with the creators of Doomlings
Cardboard Time Episode 33: Cape May, Doomlings, Pocket Paragons, Set a Watch: Swords of the Coin and an Interview with Chris Solis of Solis Game Studio

boardgame.name: How to get your Pink Card
boardgame.description:
Light roll and move humoristic game about being gay for 3 to 8 players.

The goal of the game is to be the first to score 500 pink points and be on the Nirvana path.

It includes trivia questions, attitude cards, and truth or dare cards. Various spaces make you move forward or backwards.

boardgame.name: Touhou Bomb Letter: Todoke Danmaku!
boardgame.description:
Day after day, Gensokyo has been hit by mysterious incidents. What's more, these incidents seem to be composited from those that had occurred before.

The shrine maiden of Hakurei Shrine, Hakurei Reimu, and her friend, the magician Kirisame Marisa, began to investigate the cause of the incident as usual.

Apparently, there are other residents who have begun their investigations, and they would like to be able to boast about having solved it before them. But who will have the most success in solving this incident?

Touhou Bomb Letter - Todoke Danmaku! contains the base Love Letter, but also adds some new twists through the introduction of 3 new types of cards.

Firstly, the Princess card can be replaced by the instigator of the incident, aka the Boss cards, each with their unique conditions. There are also cards you can use to replace or add to the typical card set with their own effects.

Next, there are Player cards featuring the protagonists of the Touhou Project games. They each have different abilities which they must spend bomb tokens to use, and earn them by fulfilling different conditions in each round.

Finally, rather than scoring basic points, players can instead draw from the Score card deck, and count up their secret totals across all 6 stages that will be counted at the end of the game.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Video Game Theme: Project Shrine Maiden

boardgame.name: Engkanto
boardgame.description:
Engkanto is an epic fantasy tabletop game set in pre-colonial Philippines with heroes and monsters of Filipino folklore.

Far off the coast of Samar lies a mysterious island that the tribes say is cursed. All who venture there never return. Enchanted beings called "Engkanto" disguise themselves as humans and lure innocent villagers to the island where they are taken to another plane of existence known as Biringan City.

The Gods have called upon four heroes endowed with the power of the legendary bird, Sarimanok to sail to the cursed island, find Biringan City and rescue the kidnapped villagers.

The game is for 1-4 players. Each player control a Bayani (hero) of their choice. The Bayani's goal is to venture through Enchanted Forests, explore dark caves, cross seas and head to Samar to find the legendary Biringan City. During their adventure they will find treasure to offer to ancient Filipino deities, collect items to help them survive and weapons to help them fight off the Engkanto that will try to destroy them.

boardgame.name: Cleopatra and the Society of Architects: Deluxe Edition – Scarabs
boardgame.description:
A set of 3D Treasure Scarabs with engraved Egyptian numbers underneath.

The Premium edition came with lapis luzuli colored Scarabs. Turquoise colored Scarabs were sold separately.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Cleopatra and the Society of Architects: Deluxe Edition

boardgame.name: Overlay Strike
boardgame.description:
Overlay Strike is a two-player turn based battle card game where players Overlay, Defend and Draw to reduce their opponents score from 100 down to 0 before your opponent does the same to you!

To Overlay you must stack cards of different ranks from your hand. You'll draw through your deck to get Overlay resources and defense cards as you race to get your opponents score down.

Overlay Strike contains two identical 56-card decks with 40 point cards, 8 draw cards and 8 defense cards. Games last ten to fifteen minutes with one to two rounds being played per game.

—description from the designer

listing.notes: Ship to Canada and USA only at this time.

boardgame.name: Tome of Beasts 2
Tome of Beasts II
boardgame.description:
A Murder of New 5th Edition Monsters!
WIZARD: “It says it used to be a dragon of the outer darkness…”
FIGHTER: “What does that even mean? Used to be? What is it now? Does anyone else speak Draconic?”
WIZARD: “It says you are not sufficiently respectful to its dragon nature. It says… Run?”
FIGHTER: “Run? In this armor?”
DM: “FWOOOOSH!”

Inside Tome of Beasts 2, you’ll find monsters for almost every location your heroes might journey: from farmlands to forests, dungeons to deserts, and bustling cities to fantastical planar realms—with an emphasis on dungeons and the underworld!

Tome of Beasts 2 brings you more than 400 new monsters including:

• Angelic enforcers and avalanche screamers
• Imperial dragons and swordbreaker skeletons
• Kami and clockwork tigers
• Void drakes and zombie dragons
• Death vultures and demon lords
• Swamp nagas and magma octopuses
• Chameleon hydras and shriekbats
• Walled horrors and wraith bears!

Keep your players surprised, entertained, and terrified with all-new opponents they’ve never seen before—and won’t ever see coming!

FULLY COMPATIBLE WITH THE 5TH EDITION OF THE WORLD’S FIRST ROLEPLAYING GAME!

- Publisher's Website

boardgame.name: Interceptor Ace: Volume 2 – Last Days of the Luftwaffe, 1944-45
boardgame.description:
Interceptor Ace, Volume 2: Last Days of the Luftwaffe, 1944-1945, designed by Fernando Sola Ramos, is a solitaire, tactical level game which places you in command of a German day fighter during the last days of World War II. This is the sequel to the popular, action-packed Interceptor Ace 1943-44, designed by Gregory M. Smith, and picks up the action where Interceptor Ace 1943-44 left off. Each turn consists of several days, during which a combat mission will be flown from one of many bases in Europe, attempting to intercept incoming American Bombers and defend from their escorts. There is a strong narrative around the pilot, as you look to increase your prestige, earn skills, and rise in rank through promotion and receive awards.

Interceptor Ace, Volume 2: Last Days of the Luftwaffe, 1944-45 not only is a standalone game, but fans of Interceptor Ace 1943-44 will enjoy having the capability to easily combine both games to span all the career of a German pilot from 1943 until 1945.

While the objective of the game is to conduct numerous sorties in the role of a German interceptor pilot and rack up kills, players will find it extremely challenging to survive the entire war, and will experience the brutal nature of the air war over Germany in 1944-45. Pilots may use the experience gained to improve their odds of success by purchasing skills. As their prestige increases, they may request a transfer to other fighter bases in an attempt to get "closer to the action", request a newer type of fighter or even become an elite jet fighter pilot. Awards and ace status help to narrate the player's eventual goal – to become one of the Top Guns of the Luftwaffe and survive the war.

Product Information:
Complexity: Medium
Time Scale: 3-4 days per turn
Map Scale: abstract
Unit Scale: individual aircraft, weapon systems, crew members, ammo rounds
Players: 1 (with option for 2 or more)
Solitaire: High
Playing Time: 2-3 hours

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Interceptor Ace: Daylight Air Defense Over Germany, 1943-44
Interceptor Ace: Daylight Air Defense Over Germany, 1943-44

boardgame.name: 2040: An American Insurgency
boardgame.description:
2040: An American Insurgency simulates a US civil war in the 21st century. In this 2-player, 3-hour game, the blue team is the Federals, agents of the government in Washington. The red team is the Rebels, militia groups trying to seize control of states, highways, and cities. The conflict spreads across the entire continental US, from Miami to Seattle and from Los Angeles to New York.

Two scenarios are presented. One depicts a rebellion that emerges from rural areas in the Midwest and South. The other puts the rebellion in urban areas along the coasts. As such, the game is open to multiple interpretations of future politics in the US. The game was designed not to make political statements of one kind or another, but rather to accurately model counter-insurgency operations in the continental US, regardless of who the rebels happen to be.

Many of the game mechanics are familiar from the existing body counter-insurgency sims. The resources and operations available to the two players are different; the insurgency is depicted as an asymmetric conflict. Gameplay is card-driven, however with events depicting situations that may arise in the US context. For example, if a civil war to occur, the Supreme Court is likely to make rulings that affect the conflict. Therefore, there are SCOTUS cards involving the Second Amendment and the government’s ability to make arrests. Other uniquely American features include truck stops as information networks, police brutality events, and the sports-entertainment complex.

While some of the game’s mechanics are familiar, 2040 brings many new mechanics to the table. For example, there is a fully fleshed-out social media system that affects the power of the rebellion. The Rebel player does his recruiting and fundraising through the internet, so that Federal online control measures can dramatically reduce the Rebel’s money and troop levels. This net-based conflict adds a third dimension to the insurgency, one that has not been extensively modeled in previous commercially-available simulations.

Another noteworthy feature, unique to the US, is that the suburbs and central cities of an urban area can be at diametrically opposite poles of the revolution. This creates a difficult strategic problem, in that operations that pass between two urban cores must necessarily go through the suburbs of both cities along the way. If those suburbs are enemy-controlled, the transit may be blocked. Forces inside cities can effectively be trapped by hostile suburban forces. Thus, the suburban / urban political conflict in the US has important implications for operational effectiveness.

The game components include a 22” x 34” map of the continental US, broken down by regions, cities, suburbs, and highways. Wooden pieces represent Militias (red) and Federal Security Agents (blue). Counters are used to indicate the status of a given space, from Order (pro-Federal) to Revolt (pro-Rebel). Each player has a Player Aid that summarizes the possible actions of both players.

Product Information:
Complexity: 4 out of 10
Solitaire suitability: 8 out of 10 (similar to games like Twilight Struggle)
Time scale: Not specified, but approximately one year per turn, covering a 4 to 5 year conflict
Unit scale: one unit = paramilitary cell
Players: one to two, best with two
Playing time: 2-3 hours

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Gaming Spice
ゲーミングスパイス
boardgame.description:
Gaming Spice includes 8 different spices with which the players can play two different games. The game also includes a number of "taste" cards which include a spectrum, such as Unknown/Familiar. In the game's two modes, these cards will be used to describe flavors.

Notably, the game suggests that the players' provide prosciutto (recommended), otherwise sliced cheese, in order to contain the spices.

In one game, a government spy has snuck into the Cyber Gastronomy Club. The non-spy players will taste a certain combination of spices, and all of the players will describe what they are tasting, including the spy, by drafting taste cards from a face up pool and creating a menu name for the prosciutto/cheese they tasted. The players then discuss who the spy is, and an accusation process follows.

In the other game, the Cyber Gastronomy Club has developed a new way to communicate through spices. One player creates a spice mix and the players attempt, through taste, to determine the spices. The player creating the mix reveals three sets of 2 taste cards, with the top card of each pair obscuring the second card. The second card includes an arrow which points to one side of the top card. The player creates a mix of spices such that the other player(s) will be able to deduce the menu name of the prosciutto/cheese flavor (where the arrows are pointing.)
boardgame.boardgamedesigner: 反社会人サークル (Anti-Civic Circle)
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Hanshakaijin Circle (反社会人サークル)

boardgame.name: Roma Victrix: Campaigns of the Roman World
boardgame.description:
Roma Victrix is a grand strategic, moderate complexity wargame for 1 to 6 players, covering a time period ranging from 218 BC to 533 AD in twenty separate historical and hypothetical scenarios.

We find that the Romans owed the conquest of the world to no other cause than continual military training, exact observance of discipline in their camps, and unwearied cultivation of the other arts of war. - Publius Flavius Vegetius Renatus, De Re Militari

City. Republic. Empire. Roma Victrix – “Rome Victorious”. Rome was forged in war. Even the story of its legendary founding was rooted in a fratricidal conflict. From her humble origins to her ultimate fall, Rome was either in a constant state of war, or preparing for it.
Beginning with the Punic Wars until the deposition of the last emperor in the West, Rome was the dominant force in the Mediterranean basin.

Roma Victrix is a game which endeavors to re-create the conflicts between Rome and her neighbors to achieve and maintain that dominance. A simple interactive sequence of play guides each player through the process of revenue collection, recruiting and maintaining military forces, conducting land and naval operations, diplomacy, field battles and sieges. Special rules are included to emphasize the importance and effects of leadership, cavalry superiority, mobility and attrition. Random events are also represented, adding an element of unpredictability to even the best laid plans and the likelihood that no scenario will ever play the same.

Seventeen historical scenarios range from the 2nd Punic War through the attempted reconquest of the lost Western territories by Justinian in the mid-6th century A.D. The rivalries of the later Republic, the Year of the Four Emperors, Imperial expansion and civil war, the Parthian and Persian frontier, the upheaval of the third century and the Germanic invasions are all represented. Three hypothetical scenarios are also included in which players can create their own history. Of the twenty scenarios in Roma Victrix, two are ideally suited for solitaire play.

Product Information:
Complexity: 5 out of 10
Time Scale: 1 year per turn
Area Movement Map
Unit Scale: Legions, Legionary Equivalents, Barbarian Warbands
Players: one to six
Playing Time: 3-8 hours depending upon scenario

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Invasão
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Desde 1957, eles estão entre nós... Protegidos pelo governo dos Estados Unidos e diversas outras organizações militares secretas européias, alienígenas têm realizado experimentos em nossas populações, abduzindo pessoas e testando armas e equipamentos… Preparando-se para a Invasão. Este é um jogo de RPG de intriga, espionagem, conspiração e ficção científica, baseado nos documentos secretos da CIA e do FBI a respeito do contato dos seres humanos com organizações alienígenas desde a década de 50.

Invasão inclui regras para jogar com Agentes Especiais do FBI, (incluindo agentes do DEA e US Marshalls), Men in Black, Majestic-12, Umbra Domini e NORAD (incluindo a divisão UFO Team). Traz regras para a criação de Armas e Equipamentos especiais, poderes Psiônicos e regras para Implantes Cibernéticos.

Se você gosta de Ficção Científica, conspiração, tecnologia e Arquivos-X, este é o seu jogo!

boardgame.name: Murder, She Rolled
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Murder, She Rolled is a live-action detective game series where you and your friends have to find clues, question the witness, and interrogate the suspect in hopes of getting a signed confession. Are you up to the task or will the killer walk away scot free?

User summary:

Murder, She Rolled was a LARP from ca. 2015. It was played on at least one occasion, though the rules were never published formally.

boardgame.name: Przetrwaliście zagładę
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Przetrwaliście zagładę is a role-playing card game for 4-6 players. Games typically last 10-25 minutes. The game is published as a deck of 30 cards, including:


5 starting items distributed among players
5 items to get during the game
7 action cards
2 event cards
11 endings


Publisher's blurb:

Przetrwaliście zagładę ("surviving the holocaust") is a game for 2-5 people that transforms known themes from role-playing games into a card game, allowing you to create stories about characters who survived the Holocaust. The game does not require the presence of the game master, and a single session or game lasts from 10 to 25 minutes.

boardgame.name: Samaris Tabletop
boardgame.description:
User summary:

This is a tabletop system that can be used as a companion rule set with Samaris: Der Turm von Osma (1987), which can be played both solitaire and in groups, either as a strategic game or in a role-playing manner. It extends the game by individual character properties and rules for special movement and actions as well as tables for items and costs and for spells. Samaris tabletop was presumably published in the late 1980s.

See also Samaris Tabletop.

boardgame.name: Anna, the Miller's Daughter
Duet
Temper
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Duet is a "Passerine" collection, which is to say that it pushes the edges of what I understand games to be,
and the spaces that they are played in.

Duet contains [two games]:

Temper - a game played on the edges of your life about working through your real-life anger
Anna, the Miller's Daughter - a one-or-two player map-drawing story game about a girl in a storybook village


User summary:

Temper and the print version of Anna, the Miller's Daughter were not offered separately.

See also Anna, the Miller's Daughter.

boardgame.name: We're No Heroes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this thrilling kick-off to the new Fly Free or Die Starfinder Adventure Path, a crew of scoundrels, rogues, and misfits finds it hard to survive in a galaxy where everyone has a price. Targeted by a crime boss and his army of enforcers, preyed upon by faceless mega-corporations, and hounded by rivals, the crew of the Free Trader Oliphaunt line up the big score that will at last make them rich beyond their wildest dreams. But when their many enemies join forces and the crew loses it all, they find out there's two things in the galaxy that can't be bought: freedom... and revenge.

It's just another day punching the clock when the player characters, a blue-collar transport crew, are blamed for a bad cargo and stiffed of their bonuses. They take a dangerous job smuggling weapons to a world conquered by militant hobgoblins, but one fiasco later, they're in debt to a crime boss and about to be fired. Their only chance is to steal the Oliphaunt, an experimental cargo hauler with a magical secret, and then survive long enough to collect the payoff!

“We're No Heroes" is a Starfinder Roleplaying Game adventure for four 1st-level characters. It makes an excellent introduction to the game for new players. The adventure begins the Fly Free or Die Adventure Path, a six-part, monthly campaign in which a merchant crew with an experimental starship tries to get rich, escape interplanetary assassins, and outwit their rivals. This volume also includes rules for finding, buying, and selling interstellar cargo (and using the profits to enhance your starship), a collection of deadly threats, and a player's guide that provides advice and new character creation options ideal for this Adventure Path.

boardgame.name: Aliens of Charted Space: Volume 1
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Portraying an alien race or a member of one is a challenge. It is easy to pick a few significant characteristics and overplay them, creating a caricature, or turn them into a generic human with a different hat by not accentuating their differentness. The key to a plausible alien is to understand their motivations and what makes their society work. Nobody does anything without a reason, even if the reason is unknown or incomprehensible to outsiders.

boardgame.name: The Siege of Chipyong-Ni
boardgame.description:
The second issue of the Mini Wargame Magazine contains a wargame that simulates the battle of Chipyong-Ni during the Korean War.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Chipyong-ni

boardgame.name: Another Drop Of Madness In Wonderland
boardgame.description:
The tea party has been going on since forever and the place is in a lot of mess by now. The Red Queen has just announced that she is bored and she would attend the tea party shortly.

Help your odd friends to clean up the place by collecting and creating sets of cards. At the end of the game the player with the most victory points wins.

With a mix of set collection and wacky mechanic to gather the items this game is a perfect filler for a family evening or with friends.

boardgame.name: Help! The Game
boardgame.description:
This game was released by an insurance company in Australia (NRMA).

It's time to roll the dice on everything you own. In HELP! The Game you experience real-life risks without having to risk anything. Make your way around Australia and face floods, fires, tremors, tornadoes, burglars and bin chickens. Remember to protect your assets with our HELP! domes because one wrong move could wipe you out of the game.

Whoever has the most assets still intact at the end, wins.

boardgame.name: Dice Petanque
boardgame.description:
A dice-throwing game for up to four players. In each round the diamond is thrown into the field, and each player gets to throw their two dice, hoping to land closest to the diamond.
Positive points are scored for having the die closest to the diamond or for having both one's dice show the same number. In either case the player scores the sum of their dice.
Negative points are scored for throwing one's die outside of the field (the die's value) or for throwing or knocking the diamond out of the field (five points).

—user summary

boardgame.name: Four Gardens: I Giardini d'Oriente – Capriccio degli dèi
Im Schatten der Pagode: Göttliche Gaben
신들의 정원: 신들의 변덕 (Four Gardens: The Gods' Caprice)
boardgame.description:
The gods' caprice is in the realm of incomprehensibility. But if you seize the chance at the right moment, you can turn it into a blessing. Win the gods' favor before your opponents in the evermore unpredictable situations.

신들의 변덕 (The Gods' Caprice) is a promotional expansion for Four Gardens, and contains a dual-layer scoring board and 10 promo tiles.
-description from Publisher

boardgame.name: Top Wing: Island Rescue Game
boardgame.description:
Based on the children's animated series Top Wing, players traverse the board while completing missions to gain badges and earn their wings. Take on the role of one of the four cadets and race to the rescue.

On each player's turn, they spin the spinner and move their chosen cadet. Players must earn badges by landing on the appropriate spaces on the board. Once a player has earned one badge of every color, the game is over and that player is declared the winner.

boardgame.name: Wejdź w Reakcję: Zaginiony eksperyment
boardgame.description:
Wejdź w Reakcję: Zaginiony eksperyment (Re-action:Lost Experiment) is a hybrid of escape room game and experimental kit. The box contains:

deck of cards with riddles and quizes, which allows players to participate in exciting laboratory investigation
experimental kit of reagents and tools to conduct 10 biochemical experiments.


Joined two different worlds (science and boardgames) provides an unique thematic, immersive game.

Wejdź w Reakcję: Zaginiony eksperyment was published thanks to cooperation of Games Development (boardgame publisher) and BioCen (Foundation of bioeducation).

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Zine of Wondrous Power (Issue 04) From the Past Into the Future
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue 04
featuring:

A Talmudic Bestiary - A collection of creatures from Jewish lore. Compatible with Old-School Essentials.
Welcome to the Dalelands - An essay about my travels in the Midwest and how it tied into my gaming life.
DaVinci Labs: WRK400 Workman Modular Mecha - A technical profile on a utilitarian mecha.
What’s the Point of It? - An essay about gaming while the world burns around you, and why I still do it.
The Ioun Codex: The Iounmancer - A prestige class about mastery of ioun magic. Compatible with Old-School Essentials.
The Secret of Brook’s Mine - A small dungeon crawl with an out-of-this-world surprise.
Games as Essays - An essay about games primarily expressing ideas rather than rules for play.

boardgame.name: The Ioun Codex: Appendix
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Ioun Codex: Appendix is a 16-page, full-color zine featuring material from and inspired by The Ioun Codex for the Old-School Essentials roleplaying game by Necrotic Gnome.

Featuring:

Welcome to the Ioun Codex: Appendix
Iounmancer Prestige Class
Jeddan Character Class and Ancestry
Knight of Jeddus Character Class
Unorthodox Uses: Rules
Bestiary: Rules
New Spells

boardgame.name: 20 Vile Vapors (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Toxic gas is one the most common hazards faced by explorers of sewers, dungeons, and other subterranean spaces. Some of these foul vapors are naturally occurring, while others are the byproducts of magical catastrophes, alchemical experiments gone awry, or interdimensional incursions into the mortal plane. Assassins and tyrants alike often weaponize such gases to subjugate or terrorize those who oppose them.

20 Vile Vapors presents twenty rare and unusual vapors to terrorize your players, including ghoul fog, lavender reek, and stygian dioxide. These gasses that dissolve memories, transform flesh to copper, or grant mind-bending visions.

Plus it includes a new spell Niznoc's exhalation, which lets players harness the vapors from this book.

boardgame.name: Rogue Genius Ancestries: Loamlings
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Can You Dig It?!

Loamlings are a new ancestry for the second edition of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Molelike in form, loamlings have a strong connection to the earth and growing things makes that loamlings natural farmers, druids, and herbalists. Written by veteran second-edition designer Michael Sayre, this fully-illustrated pdf presents the loamling ancestry with all the roleplaying notes, background, and game rules (including four heritages and 20 ancestry feats) needed to make them an interesting and well-rounded part of your campaign!

boardgame.name: Magic Items 1
Magical Items
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With Magic Items 1 you will find six unique items waiting to be either a reward for your player characters or burdens, depending on your mood.

Ghost Ward Lantern - Press back ghosts and other incorporeal undead
Gladiator's Blood Gloves - increase your unarmed attacks
Longsword of Piety - twist fate to your will if you are worthy
Sword of Pursuit - track those that are guilty
Teeth of the Dead - commune with the departed
Undertakers Oil - makes the mundane magical for a brief time

boardgame.name: Amoral Prodigy Background
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With the Amoral Prodigy Background, you are better at something than almost anyone else around. Alchemy, weaponsmithing, archery, singing, you name it... you are the best. Although you have a lot of fame, you lack empathy and can sometimes be a bit shallow. While evil is implied, good characters can benefit from the Amoral Prodigy Background as well. They just have to work it a little harder...

boardgame.name: Vathak Spells 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With Vathak Spells 1 we dive into three twisted spells that bring great power to the caster.

Bellow of the Grave - This cantrip gives you the voice of the dead and all that entails
Hands of the Dead - Hands rise from the ground to grapple your opponents
Howl of the Beast - Frighten your opponents with your keening wail

boardgame.name: Feats of Devotion and Deliverance
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With Feats of Devotion and Deliverance you will find options for the pious and the devoted to include:

Bestow Piety - Channel purity, hope, and clarity to your allies
Disciplined Mind - Bring your focus to bear, sharp as a knife.
Slayer of Horrors - Your skill at slaying a certain type of horror is unmatched.

boardgame.name: The Wretched
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Wretched have origins of horrific scientific and magical experimentation. Vindari scientists using a combination of bhriota rituals, romni legends, and galvanizing equipment reanimated the corpses of fallen military soldiers. The goal was to create a more controllable undead, one that could be trained to fight the Spawn of the Old Ones and spare the lives of living people.

Instead... they got something else.

boardgame.name: A Night at Wayside Inn
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for 7th-10th Level Characters set in the Shadows over Vathak 5e campaign setting using the world's most popular role-playing game rules!

All is not as it appears at this charming roadside tavern. What an adventuring party may perceive as a welcome respite from the wilderness is really a den of iniquity determined
to feed on their life experiences, leaving them at best weakened and at worst… well we simply won’t discuss the worst as our heroes will hopefully do as heroes should and rid the world of this tainted evil architecture once and for all! Right?!

Welcome to the Wayside Inn! A seemingly innocent tavern of misfortune and mischief that preys upon the occasional traveler. Nearly always found amidst a deluge of poor weather or nestled along paths where roads are long and adventurers are desperately weary, this restless piece of architecture is the perfect mini-adventure to break the monotony of long treks.

boardgame.name: Abyssal Elk
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The abyssal elk is a creature that can sometimes manifest from a remote plane consisting of an infinite forest. These malevolent beings seem to enjoy occupying forests in the material realm, and scaring and eating those that venture into its path.

boardgame.name: Mudwake Boar
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The mudwake boar is a fearsome creature that roams the remote wilderness and tends to prevent the encroachment of civilization into its zone of influence. Tales claim that mudwake boars are mutated by the taint of the land, while others claim that the very land itself blessed the boar with its potency to protect
the ecosystem.

boardgame.name: Graven Earth Elemental
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A graven earth elemental is often born of the mixture of energies emanating from earth and death. It most often appears around death mounds, catacombs, and other earthen graves that somehow finds a connection to both the elemental plane of earth, and the negative energy plane.

boardgame.name: Zombie Worm
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Zombie worms are created from spare tissue not used in the creation of more robust undead creatures. A fully empowered zombie worm exists only to attach itself to a living being, and drain them of energy. Similar to a leech, it will remain attached until it has had its fill, and vigorously resists extraction.

boardgame.name: For What Remains: Blood on the Rails
boardgame.description:
For What Remains is a skirmish-level series of three wargames set in a post-apocalyptic near future:

Streets of Ruin
Blood on the Rails
Out of the Basement


Blood on the Rails features the Echo and Soldiers of Light factions, set in the Blood on the Rails campaign. The Echo is a faction led by a secretive cabal of humans with psychic powers, and the Soldiers of Light are humans who believe the fall of mankind was brought about due to a dependence on technology.

The game is designed for 2-player competitive play or solitaire play, and each set can be played by itself standalone, or combined with other sets to form a larger narrative. Players control characters from one of the game’s six Factions.

There are two ways to play For What Remains: skirmishes and campaigns. Skirmishes are standalone games played for a single victory, with no lasting repercussions. Campaigns are a series of skirmishes linked together to form a larger narrative. For What Remains is a scenario driven game. Each scenario typically has multiple objectives, and combat between factions is usually secondary. Players win skirmishes by gaining victory points through accomplishing these objectives.

The game board is built from modular tiles which are themed to represent different environments. The default game board is a destroyed urban setting. Players build the game board with nine modular tiles, each of which are divided into a 7x7 grid. Characters use the grids for movement.

Each character is represented by a counter and has a corresponding character card and tokens. During campaign play, characters improve their attributes and develop new abilities as they progress from Recruit to Veteran and then Elite level. A chit pull system is used for unit activation, and a step-loss system is used for tracking injuries during skirmishes.

—description from the designer

For What Remains: Streets of Ruin

boardgame.boardgameintegration: For What Remains: Out of the Basement
For What Remains: Streets of Ruin

boardgame.description:

Streets of Ruin
Blood on the Rails
Out of the Basement


Out of the Basement features the Erthen and Order of the New Dawn factions, set in the Out of the Basement campaign. The Erthen are a biologically developed race formed from a mixture of human, mineral, and organic matter, and the Order of the New Dawn are creatures from the strange subterranean realm known as the Basement.

The game is designed for 2-player competitive play or solitaire play, and each set can be played by itself standalone, or combined with other sets to form a larger narrative. Players control characters from one of the game’s six Factions.

There are two ways to play For What Remains: skirmishes and campaigns. Skirmishes are standalone games played for a single victory, with no lasting repercussions. Campaigns are a series of skirmishes linked together to form a larger narrative. For What Remains is a scenario driven game. Each scenario typically has multiple objectives, and combat between factions is usually secondary. Players win skirmishes by gaining victory points through accomplishing these objectives.

The game board is built from modular tiles which are themed to represent different environments. The default game board is a destroyed urban setting. Players build the game board with nine modular tiles, each of which are divided into a 7x7 grid. Characters use the grids for movement.

Each character is represented by a counter and has a corresponding character card and tokens. During campaign play, characters improve their attributes and develop new abilities as they progress from Recruit to Veteran and then Elite level. A chit pull system is used for unit activation, and a step-loss system is used for tracking injuries during skirmishes.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Anatomy of Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In just a few short years, M.T. Black has established himself as one of the most successful indie-writers on the Dungeons & Dragons scene, with thirty-five platinum best-sellers and over a hundred thousand book sales. In this practical and engaging book, he shares many of the principles, tricks, and secrets he has learned along the way.

boardgame.name: Murder Mystery Case File: Der Tote im Weinkeller
Murder Mystery Party Case Files: Underwood Cellars
boardgame.description:
In the Murder Mystery Party Case File – Underwood Cellars, players work to solve a murder using the case file and evidence provided. It’s been 30 years since famed winemaker Cary Underwood disappeared. Due to a recent earthquake, his body has been discovered, along with more clues to crack this case. Work alone or with others to identify the killer’s motive, means and opportunity to commit the murder.

The Underwood Cellars Case File contains over 50 pieces of evidence to help detectives determine who had the motive, means and opportunity to pull off the murder of Cary Underwood. The Underwood Cellars Case File includes crime scene photos, witness interviews, newspaper clippings, and much more to help you determine who committed murder.

uring a murder investigation, a detective must answer the following three questions:

Motive: Who had a reason to kill the victim? Did any particular person benefit - financially or romantically - from the victim's death? Was it a case of revenge?

Means: Who had access to the murder weapon and victim? Did any particular person have the unique knowledge, skill or physical ability necessary to use the murder weapon?

Opportunity: Who had a chance to kill the victim? Is any particular person unaccounted for (has no alibi) during the time the victim was killed?

Each Case File Comes With:
8 Victim and Suspect Photos
8 Crime Scene Photos
6 Newspaper Articles
32 Pieces of Case Evidence
Online Access to Hints and Solutions
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Murder Mystery Party Case Files (University Games)

boardgame.name: Psychics and Sidekicks
boardgame.description:
When the world is in peril, powerful heroes step up to save the day. Those heroes know they are mortal though, and they cannot battle the forces of evil forever. It is up to them to also train the next generation of heroes who will take up the fight when they are gone.

In this game, you will...
•Play a powerful, world-saving hero called a Psychic.
•Play another player’s protégé called a Sidekick.
•Coach your Sidekick after each mission
•Stop petty criminals and evil masterminds

In Psychics and Sidekicks, you create two characters: your ultra-powerful Psychic and another player’s Sidekick. When small-time criminals and mid-level crime lords threaten the city, you’ll take your Sidekick on a mission to stop them. After each mission, your Psychic will debrief you on your experiences and help you learn from them. If a huge threat should arise before your Sidekick is ready to face it on their own, the Psychic springs into action and shows everyone how it’s done.

boardgame.name: Houston, We Have a Dolphin!: Cyborg Heroes
boardgame.description:
After our heroes have bravely sacrificed themselves to decouple the ship modules and avert a dolphin catastrophe... - THEY RETURN.

But there's something odd about them...

Each hero gains a special ability to use after opening a module. While Doctor Sam now revives lost astronauts, Trainer Judy suddenly seems to fight on the dolphins side, disturbing the repairing of the ship.

Discover the enhanced CYBORG heroes, choose between their new abilities and give your game the extra strategy kick!

Includes 5 extra heroes and a new captain.

This is an expansion for the base game game Houston, we have a Dolphin! (https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/301317/houston-we-have-d...)

boardgame.name: Sardinia (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
boardgame.description: Ticket to Ride Sardinia is a fan-produced map of Sardinia by Davide Fornasini. The cities on the map are 45 and the map can be played with the original rules of TTR Europe or with the TTR Sardinia's custom rules.

boardgame.name: Mysterium Park: Release Promo Card
boardgame.description: This promo was released alongside Mysterium Park and provided to retailers with the first printing of the game. It depicts a circus fly being watched by a menacing spider.

boardgame.name: Hey Yo
헤이, 요!
boardgame.description:
In Hey Yo: The Card Game to the Beat, you all play cards to a shared music chart so that you can ideally create solid rhythms and score points. The game includes a small dedicated device that you can use to accompany the gameplay, with players needing to play a card when the music indicates this. If you can't play in time to the rhythm, you're penalized, so you must talk quickly to share information and decide which cards to play. (Alternatively, you can play music of your choice to set the rhythm of play for the game.)

Hey Yo includes two identical decks of cards, so instead of playing a co-operative game with 2-5 players, you can have 4-10 players split into teams to compete against one another.

Title: Hey Yo Publisher: Oink Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Terra Lìbera
boardgame.description:
Terra Lìbera is a board game inspired by the ancient history of Sardinia. It wants to convey, through a game experience, the social transformations of the peoples who inhabited Sardinia through Nuragic, Phoenician, Punic and Roman times. Players go through history by living it in a game, looking for resources and being careful not to get enslaved.

The players assume the role of different populations in Sardinia. They are represented by nuraghes (ancient megalithic edifices) of different colours, that must collect resources (minerals, grape, oil, wheat, livestock, wood, brick). Depending on the number of nuraghes built in a territory, they will be considered free, masters, or slaves, and in the latter case, they will have to deliver the harvest to the master. During the turn, the players can increase their nuraghes population, move the nuraghes on the map, fight the opposing nuraghes to hunt them or to rebel against the masters, plunder the enemy's harvest. They also use the accumulated resources to improve production (mine, vineyard, quarry, field), transport, or start trading.

The aim is to solve more objective cards than the other players, trying not to hold unresolved objective cards on hand at the end of the game.
The most skilled players will be those who will be able to adapt to what history asks them.

boardgame.name: Lucius 3
Lucius III
boardgame.description:
Lucius is back. This time he returns to his old neighborhood of Winter Hill. Through trials and tribulations we will finally see where the road takes him.

It's a difficult one. For the first time, his choices come to question.

Is it finally time to end it all?

The game follows Lucius and McGuffin as they commit a series of murders in Winter Hill, in order to break the scroll's seven seals and bring about the apocalypse.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Black Sites
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

HIDDEN HORRORS
"It is absolutely necessary, for the peace and safety of mankind, that some of earth's dark, dead corners and unplumbed depths be let alone; lest sleeping abnormalities wake to resurgent life, and blasphemously surviving nightmares squirm and splash out of their black lairs to newer and wider conquests." —H.P. Lovecraft, "At the Mountains of Madness."

Eight Delta Green operations lock bystanders and Agents alike in unlit rooms with the cosmic terrors of the unnatural. Unwanted survivals rise from death or slumber into the nightmarish life of humanity.


PX POKER NIGHT: At an isolated Air Force base, discontented service members listen to the night sky and hear secrets not meant for human ears.
KALI GHATI: A Delta Green operative goes missing from a combat base in the Afghanistan war. A handful of agents in-country must learn what discovery lured him across the wire. Then they must bring him home.
THE LAST EQUATION: A gifted university student guns down a family of total strangers, leaving behind a string of numbers that fills Delta Green’s researchers with dread. Can your Agents stop the next horrific slaughter?
LOVER IN THE ICE: A bitter midwestern winter shuts down a city and awakens a long-forgotten threat. A threat that is all too ready to spread.
SWEETNESS: Vandalism on a family home makes the police fear a hate crime. Delta Green recognizes something worse. What connections have these ordinary folk made to bring such danger to their door?
HOURGLASS: A woman vanishes, screaming, in front of dozens of witnesses in a small Oregon town. Your Agents must find what killed her, stop the threat, and make sure no one else ever learns the truth.
EX OBLIVIONE: Vicious murders stain the Arizona desert. Crazed words scrawled at a crime scene hint at Y’ha-nthlei and the sea. A handful of Agents have a chance to claim vengeance for ancient wrongs—or suffer it.
THE CHILD: A traumatized child looks to the Agents for protection from voices that never cease.


A detailed index helps Handlers build broader connections between horrors in their campaigns.

boardgame.name: Czółko: Junior
boardgame.description: Czółko Junior is a family edition of the popular party game Czółko, in which players guess phrases using questions. There are as many as 330 phrases in 8 categories on the illustrated cards, thanks to which the game will ensure a long fun for the whole family.

boardgame.name: Stainless Past
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

This is a rpg about people gradually discovering each other’s secrets when confronted to a crisis. Will they be able to overcome their disputes and survive? Or will they face each other until disaster strikes?

User summary:

Stainless Past was one of two submissions by the same author for the 2020 RPG Geek 24 Hour RPGs. As the contest terms allow only one entry per author, this game is not eligible for consideration in the voting process. Please see At the Bloody Paladin for the eligible entry.

boardgame.name: Robot Overload
boardgame.description:
You are the commander of a small robot army. You’ll strategically deploy your robots to fight your battles. Your stronger robots will reprogram weaker robots to fight for your side. Command your robot army, reprogram opposing forces, and become the Robot Master of the World!

Description
This is a 2 player game where players strategically select from their hand of robot cards as they attack and defend. Additional copies of the game can expand the number of players who can play.

Play
Players strategically select from their hand of robot cards as they attack and defend. Each time a player defeats their opponent's robot, they become the attacker on the next round. The defender has the advantage of choosing how to respond to the attacker's card, and may choose to sacrifice both robots to attempt to capture the robots in their opponent's hand. When one player runs out of cards, they are defeated and their opponent is the Robot Master of the World!

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Adult Choices
boardgame.description:
Choices transports players into the world of decision making. It is an adventure of thought that begins with a dilemma and ends with a choice. Tucked in between is competition, verbal action, and a lot of guesswork.

—description from the back of the box

boardgame.name: Plan'it Board Game
boardgame.description:
Plan'it is a competitive and strategic card game for 2 to 4 players, in which you should be the first traveller who explores the six continents. For achieve you goal, you must live three kind of experiences: adventure, nature and cultural trips. However, you are not the only passionated traveller in the game, other characters are trying to visit the whole world before you.

The carddeck is really artistic and original, because the cards have a key color in their back part. Thus, other players could suposse your strategy, and they will try to sabbotagge it, but only you are the one who knows which country is the next in your plan. You have to "plan it" properly, because you must manage your budget for your trips, but also the weather conditions and you must combinate the three experiences (adventure, nature and culture).

Are you ready to live the adventure of exploring the world from your table?

boardgame.name: Clash of Deck N°4
boardgame.description:
Clash of Deck is an evolving do-it-yourself card game. This is the fourth expansion of the game. Each month, a new expansion is released, which allows you to create new decks and thus increase the replayability of the game.

In Clash of Deck, you play as a Sorcerer Lord whose objective is to take control of the safest islands of the Erret Archipelago. To do this you will have to fight other Witchlords.

This expansion is made up of 16 new cards as well as 2 new visuals of Bridge cards. A new game mechanic makes its appearance: the cards which rotate on themselves. You will also be able to discover three new special abilities that will add even more combos and depth to your games: Revive, Second Wind and Leap!

boardgame.name: Belly of the Vellum Wyrm
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tales of the Vellum Wyrm speak of a creature with a parchment-like skin that folds itself erratically through the dimensions. It consumes everything in its path, but that path might weave through a thousand untold universes. Unsuspecting inhabitants of those realms going blindly about their lives might be suddenly swallowed, leaving behind friends and family who wonder where they vanished. Others hunt out the wyrm, either to recover that which it has taken, or in hopes of vanquishing the beast and harvesting its papery skin.

While often its split-second foray into a given world goes unnoticed, to those that do lay eyes on it the wyrm appears fractured, as a crystal chandelier smashed upon a polished marble floor, or, perhaps more aptly, as an antediluvian tome, unbound, its pages scattered to capricious winds.

User summary:

This innovative dungeon is printed and then receives an origami fold to become a dungeon shaped like a serpent.

boardgame.name: Antiquities and Curiosities
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The party has learned of The Annual Strange Antiquities and Curiosities Gala. Hosted by the eccentric and reclusive Lady, on her luxury inter-sphere golden cruise barge, the gala's main even is an auction, where some of the most rare and valuable artifacts will be sold to the highest bidder.

boardgame.name: Haunt-House
boardgame.description:
Publisher's description:

Do you remember the “haunted house” in the neighborhood where you grew up? The tangly weeds of its neglected yard? The way its rotten porch gaped like a mouth of blackened teeth? The scaly dishevelment of its siding? How long when passing would you stare through its windows, driven to catch a glimpse inside -yet terrified of what you might see? Haunted houses play a seminal part of growing up in small-town America. This adventure follows a club of adolescent misfits as they explore a haunted house. -Ya’ don’t REALLY believe in GHOSTS -do ya’?

Haunt-House is part of a “Triple-Dog-Dare” for the upcoming RPG game “The Dare-Luck Club.” It is a collection of 3 adventures themed around an exquisite map of an abandoned Victorian manor. Search for Old Man Grendalbach’s fortunes in, “House of Grendalbach.” When a inquisitive youth disappears, your club comes to the rescue in, “Timmy’s Missing.” -And finally, help the new girl wage war against the hellspawned creatures that plague the house she just moved into in, “The Grendalbach Gremlins.”

This book also contains “Quickstart Rules” that will teach you to play a Dare-Luck Club game using one of the 6 pregenerated characters provided here in.

So, come on, Dare-Luckers! Grab a flashlight, a couple cans of Fizzy-Gulp, and your mom’s silver letter opener (hey, ya’ never know!) -THERE’S ‘SPOLRING TO DO!

boardgame.name: Why is there a Wizard's Tower in this Dump
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The literal worst adventure ever written.
...
A cursed tower and an insane wizard. Enter this extremely stupid tower at your own risk. 6 weird floors and a bonus Trash-mancer background.

boardgame.name: Banini: The Legend of Alec
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Things have been quiet since Alec the Alligator beat the tar out of your old boss Daron Bante and rescued the adorable (but just the worst) Garbo people. Daron Bante’s loss was so pathetic, his whole army of Baninis, including you, quit on the spot and moved on with their lives.

So none of you were expecting Alec to burst into the pub and beg for your help. Daron Bante has found Alec’s long-lost parents, and is holding them hostage. The only way he’ll release them is if Alec delivers King Robbie (his adopted Garbo father) in return.

So it’s up to you! Break back into Daron Bante’s lair on Isle Purgatory, beat his newly hired minions, and set these formerly absent alligator parents free.

boardgame.name: Armistice Unknown: Prelude to Conflict
boardgame.description:

Uncover brand new musically themed items and take the joy (and horror) of music to other spheres!

You are space alien hunters, you hunt aliens in space. You comb the humpbacked sky on the hunt for aliens unseen in the core spheres. Sphere after sphere you search, discovering eclectic new creatures both friendly and not. This is one such adventure for your intrepid space crew. In space.

boardgame.name: Aitsu wa Classmate!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Aitsu wa Classmate! ("That's My Classmate!") is an RPG designed by the Atarinbou circle and published by Sunset Games. The game's slogan is "The school life you really wanted is right here!" It's an anime-style high school comedy game with details classes, skills, special abilities, and rules for relationships with other characters.

boardgame.name: Beast Bind Trinity
ビーストバインド トリニティ
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Vampire, Human Wolf, Angel, Urban Legend, Fairy, Resident of Makai, Ghost, Deity, Visitor from Space, Machine with Mind, Machine with Happiness, Clown of Hell, or Mythological Spirit - a living demon in a dark, supernatural world.

A Gothic Horror game focusing on the life of "semi-demon" characters.

boardgame.name: Starhold - A Survival Horror RPG
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Space is vast, inhospitable, and unforgiving, and we—

Well, we’re fragile.

So we build. Havens of metal and glass, lead-lined walls to protect us from radiation, armored shells to stop bullet-fast debris. Out here we’re on our own, and we make do with what we have. But what protects us also makes us vulnerable. When disaster strikes, when there’s nowhere to run, our shelter can become our prison. But we keep going, because we—

Well, we’re determined, too.

Starhold is a game about survival. You play a group of spacers struggling on the fringes of the last great frontier, scraping by in a cold universe. Out here even the smallest mistake can mean extinction, and help is a long, long way away. Pick your spacers, map your base, and buckle in.

This is gonna be one hell of a ride.

User summary:

The included playbooks also are available as a free, separate download from the publisher site.

boardgame.name: KAPOW! Volume 1
boardgame.description:
Superhero — or supervillain? You decide in this buildable dice game. Your customizable dice pool is used to execute a variety of superpowers. Gain special abilities and new play experiences by taking on the role of six different heroes or villains.

In KAPOW!, players go head-to-head in a classic explosive clash of good vs. evil. You choose to be a villain or hero, which determines your starting trait dice and unique abilities. You can gain additional blank "action dice" that have removable faces that that you customize to your liking to best enhance your character. Behind a player screen, you roll dice, then allocate them to attack, defense, and power-up abilities. The combination of choosing how to grow your dice pool, how to customize your action die faces, and how to use each roll leads to a satisfying, strategic showdown.

KAPOW! Volume 1 contains six supers: Tough Nut, Elusivity, and Time Out are the heroes, while Victor Kane, Coquette, and Spoiler Alert are the villains. This set can be combined with KAPOW! Volume 2 to mix and match the characters or have up to four players in one game.

boardgame.name: Batman: The Dark Knight Returns Board Game
boardgame.description:
In the solitaire Batman: The Dark Knight Returns Board Game, you play "The World's Greatest Detective", who's been pulled back from retirement into a gritty Gotham. Do everything you can to beat back a relentless tide of ruthless mutants, cops, and press looking to bring you down. Instead of traditional leveling up, this is a game of attrition. An old Batman tries to survive one final gauntlet, facing old and new villains — such as Two Face, Billy Berserk, and The Joker — and even his most powerful ally, The Man of Steel himself.

The game is playable as standalone "missions" or one epic playthrough in which the results of each mission carry over to the next.

boardgame.name: Clay Crusher
boardgame.description:
The board game that requires creativity, strategy and a little back stabbing. Make your finest sculpture in a short amount of time and try to avoid your friends crushing your creations, and your dreams.

The basic premise is each round there is a new judge. The judge selects an idea card for the players to create during the round. A time limit is selected and the players frantically sculpt. The judge rank the sculptures on the table and the players will move accordingly. 1st place moves forward 3 spaces, 2nd place moves two spaces, 3rd place moves 3 spaces, and the rest don’t move at all.

Along the way you will encounter rule squares, penalty squares and star squares, if you land on one of them, pick up a card with the corresponding symbol. Penalty squares make you sculpt with one hand or move back a space, stuff like that. Star squares typically give players the best card in the game, a Clay Crusher card. This means at the end of any future round the player can use their Clay Crusher card to smash another player's creation before the judge sees it. First one around the board wins!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: The Tragedy of Othello
boardgame.description:
The Tragedy of Othello is a tragic and treacherous Shakespeare-themed card game where you and your opponents are actors auditioning for the lead role of the villainous Iago, trying to impress the casting director with your ability to embody Iago’s treachery and deceit! You will play script cards from the cast of characters to gain points as you advance Shakespeare’s script, and play staging cards to disrupt the play of your rivals. Also play mind, character and spotlight tokens to strategically improve your position or leave characters for dead. When you control the lead character in each act, your opportunities to gain points increase. You will want to control Iago as much as possible in Acts I–IV. Then control Othello in Act V, so you can strike the final tragic blow!

Alas, opportunities exist to steal points, so take heed: opponents playing the other characters may try to upstage you! The actor who accumulates the most points at the end of Act V wins the game by stealing the spotlight and landing the role of Iago!

No Shakespeare knowledge required.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Killing Cards: Aliens
boardgame.description:
You wake up in a cryogenic chamber at the same time as the other players. As soon as you come to your senses, a voice announces: "Welcome to our game. You are aboard the Spartacus ship, which sails not far from the planet Pandora."

Your goal is to be a player to stay alive. You take turns opening a door to the ship. Behind each door you will find either a bloodthirsty monster or equipment that can help you survive. The last survivor will be released.

Each player chooses one of the characters, receives a flamethrower and six cards.

Each player in turn draws a card (it is the opening of the door) look at it and places it in front of him face down.

On his turn a player can play as many cards from his hand (or none), then he must open his door (the card face down in front of him).

If the player draws an Alien or Arachnid card when he opens his door, the player must show it to the other players.

If he has a flamethrower, he discards it and draws a new door and his turn is over (if he doesn't have a flamethrower, he dies).

If the player does not draw a monster, this card enters their hand.

Finally, the player replaces his door with a new one.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Zodiac War
boardgame.description:
Zodiac War is a rotating board game based on astrological themes. The game draws on authentic themes such as personalities of the signs, aligning planets and elements, and drawing on powers of tarot cards. The game is for 1-5 players and takes about 60-90 minutes to play.

Astrology and Tarot authentically share an astrological theme and Zodiac War has been developed to merge these ideas into a fun board game.

The unique rotating board is moved by players to align planets and elements with zodiac signs, consistent with the basics of astrology. Aligning the board wins star crystals, and three star crystals light up your constellation to win the game.

Payment
PayPal - if payment is made with option Sending to a friend or family no extra % is needed; if not 5% to be added as PayPal fees We prefer the no-cost option by bank transfer via SEPA, IBAN - no extra fee
Shipping costs will be communicated with buyer at time of purchase.
For any further questions, feel free to contact us!
Played once, like new, sleeved, Tarot-size cards kickstarter edition

Still wrapped. Original Kickstarter version with stretch goals. Price includes shipping to USA only. Paypal and Zelle payments accepted. Also available as pre-order with immediate availability. Contact zodiacwargame@gmail.com if interested.

boardgame.name: Seagate Storage Expansion Card
boardgame.description: The Seagate Storage Expansion Card for Xbox Series X | S delivers an additional 1TB of external memory while maintaining the same peak speed and performance of the console's internal SSD for a streamlined gaming experience. The 1TB of extra storage means you’ll have ample space to grow your games library. Easily plug in and play, or remove the card and take your games with you. If you’re looking to add extra storage to your console, this is the card that will enable you to achieve the same performance as the Xbox Velocity Architecture when playing games that have been Optimized for Xbox Series X | S.

boardgame.name: Croc'Attack
boardgame.description:
Croc'Attack is a board game born in Crocodile Land (a.k.a Australia!) featuring Crocodiles eating people and Treasure Hunters crossing narrow bridges to find treasures on an island.
This game is adapted for 8+ yo, for 3 to 5 players.

Each player gets a pawn. One player should play the Crocodile, the rest of the players are treasure hunters.

Crocodiles:

Prevent Hunters from accessing the island,
Protect your treasures,
And eat as many hunters as possible!


Treasure hunter:

Access the island and steal as many treasures as possible,
Avoid being eaten by the crocodile,
Get more treasures than the other hunters.


The Treasure Hunters can move anywhere on the Land tiles / Bridges tiles or on the Island. The crocodile cannot reach them when they are on the Land tiles or Island, but the crocodile can access the Bridge tiles.

The games stops when all the Treasure Hunters are dead, or when there is no more Treasures to steal on the island. Points are then calculated to determine the winner.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Kamen Raidā Memorī ofu Hīrōzu
Kamen Rider: Memory of Heroez
仮面ライダー メモリーオフヒーローズ
boardgame.description:
Kamen Rider: Memory of Heroez (仮面ライダー メモリーオフヒーローズ, Kamen Raidā Memorī ofu Hīrōzu) is a video game based on the Kamen Rider Series, released for the PlayStation 4 Nintendo Switch on October, 29 2020. It features the cast from Kamen Rider W, Kamen Rider OOO and Kamen Rider Zero-One.[2][3]

The storyline is heavily focus on both Kamen Rider W and OOO, due to the absences of other Kamen Rider Zero-One cast aside Zero-One himself.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kamen_Rider%3A_Memory_of_Heroez Kamen Rider: Memory of Heroez]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: RoboRacer
boardgame.description:
RoboRacer is a turn-based race & battle game for 1 or more players. Players create movement programs for their robots in an attempt to be either the first to complete a race course or be the last bot left alive. Movement programs are specified by a sequence of 5 chips created from a hand of 9 chips (or fewer for damaged robots). The game is turn based - it waits for all players to enter their movement program for the current turn before proceeding. When the turn executes all movement programs are executed simultaneously. Bots may interfere with each other by shooting or pushing each other - so to do well at the game, players need to predict their opponents movements and find programs which best handle the possible interaction with their opponents.

Games generally advance a turn or two per day, depending on the speed and availability of the players involved. "Real-time" games can also be played when all players are online at the same time, allowing a full game to be played in one sitting.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Happy Dim Sum
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Happy Dim Sum! As a good guest, you’ll be serving tasty pieces of Har Gow, Siew Mai and other delights to your fellow diners. Discover hilarious ways to load your friends’ plates while keeping your own clear, like getting help from Grandma and battling over the bill.

Happy Dim Sum is a 2 to 5 player game where you draw Dim sum and Action cards and pass the dim sum in your hand to your friends, trying to help them complete their sets. Once a player completes 3 different sets and the relevant Daily Special cards are drawn from the deck, the players are eliminated. Make use of action cards to move the Dim Sum around and survive the Dim Sum stuffing till the last man standing!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
